article.headline: UNC Greensboro 86, Elon 73
article.story: GREENSBORO, N.C. (AP) -- Ricky Hickman scored 22 points including 15 at the foul line to help UNC Greensboro snap a three-game losing streak and defeat Elon 86-73 on Monday night. Mikko Koivisto scored 13 points, and Kyle Hines and Kevin Oleksiak added 12 points each for UNC Greensboro (13-12, 10-5 Southern Conference), while Matt Akinosho grabbed a game-high nine rebounds. Hickman, who went 15-of-18 from the foul line, tied the school record for free throws in a game. Elon (5-19, 3-11 Southern Conference) took a brief lead at 17-15 in the first half, but UNC Greensboro went on a 12-4 run to reopen a nine-point advantage and led 43-38 at the break. After Hines was ejected with 15:14 to play, UNC Greensboro went on a 28-8 run. Elon answered with six free throws from Chris Chalko, but the Spartans ran off 28 of the next 36 points and extended their lead to 74-58 with 4:46 to play. LeVonn Jordan led Elon with 20 points and eight rebounds. Chalko added 18 points, including four 3-pointers, and Scott Grable scored 14 points.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
